newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Friday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover fell to 1.986 billion yuan from 2.489 billion yuan with the seven-day contract the most actively traded.
Traders said trading was less active with head offices of state banks and short-term financial centres -- money brokerages run by the central bank -- traded less ahead of the weekend.

Despite the fall in turnover on Friday, traders said trading on the market would be greatly expanded after the central bank banned state banks trading on the state debt repurchase and spot secondary market.
The central bank announced the ban on Thursday, ordering the banks to trade their short-term funds on the interbank market.
Traders said this could cause the interbank rates to move in a wider range with volume fluctuating sharply in the near term.
